title: Blueprint, "International Casino: Showcase Displays", September 17, 1937
medium: Blueprint and ruled border on white wove paper
markings: Stamps: Architect's stamp in blueprint at lower right: DONALD DESKEY/630 FIFTH AVE-NEW YORK CITY; see inscription
inscribed: Inscribed in Architect's stamp: 546-86; 1"-1'-0-; INT. CAS.; Olsson / 9/17/37; Inscribed in blueprint at lower right: SHOW CASE DISPLAY'S [sic][underlined]/INT. CAS. N.Y.[underlined]; Inscribed in blueprint with descriptions and notes throughout.
description: Plans for the graphics of showcases for International Casino, New York City. 45th Street elevation showcases at center left have entrance in between two large rectangular showcases. Showcase on left of entrance reads, "International Casino Dining and Dancing," and at bottom in smaller lettering reads, "Open from Mon - Fri? (illegible)." Foto mural behind lettering of abstracted musical instrument, a face, martini glasses and bottle, and dancing people. Mural and showcase on right reads, "International Casino Dining and Dancing," and in smaller lettering at bottom, "Open ...(illegible)." Mural behind lettering is abstracted dancers, wine glasses, piano keys, and musical notes. Eight showcases for Broaway entrance, lettering only against glass. Each display advertises different aspect of venue and lists days/hours in smaller lettering at bottom. Color of lettering at Broadway and 45th Street entrance vary from red, blue, and black.

tombstone.epitaph:
Blueprint, "International Casino: Showcase Displays", September 17, 1937.
September 17, 1937. Blueprint and ruled border on white wove paper. Gift of Donald Deskey. 1975-11-289.
